html:
break forth on the right hand/left. Israel will grow and expand in all directions. Other versions translate the idiom break forth as "burst out" (JB), "spread out" (NIV), or "spread abroad" (RSV).

seed shall inherit the Gentiles. This passage seems to mean that the Lord's people will dispossess the Gentiles of their lands and inheritances and that Israel will then inherit what has been vacated (Deut. 2:12, 21, 22).

the desolate cities…inhabited. The children of Israel will inherit the cities of the gentiles, which will have become desolate and empty, most likely because of the wars and upheavals of the last days (49:19). The New International Version says, "Your descendants will dispossess nations and settle in their desolate cities."
